title: Ticket #794: Port of condor to SuSE (NMI)
remarks:
Still having problems building kbbd on nmi-0062: 

/usr/lib/gcc/i586-suse-linux/4.0.2/../../../libX11.so: undefined reference to `__stack_chk_fail@GLIBC_2.4'
collect2: ld returned 1 exit status
make: *** [condor_kbdd] Error 1

I've worked with the NMI folks to get the required X development libraries installed, but, even after that, I'm still getting the above. Pete's got a couple of things that he wants me to try.

2009-Oct-05 11:27:37 by tannenba:
How about building w/o the kbdd? maybe this should also be a config knob (if it isn't already) ?

In the case of NMI, they do not care about the kbdd, these are not interactive desktop machines.

2009-Oct-05 11:35:51 by nleroy:
No there isn't... I'll add such a flag if it's not too difficult. Thanks for the idea, Todd!

2009-Oct-05 11:37:27 by nleroy:
Oh, wait, never mind. There is, but I missed it in looking at the output of './configure --help', but I see it now. :) :)

2009-Oct-05 14:10:32 by nleroy:
RE: kbbd.. I have no idea what I was looking at... There is no --{enable,disable}-kbbd option. Looking into it.

2009-Oct-05 14:12:35 by nleroy:
but there is a --disable-kbdd

<sigh> Too many things going on at once, I guess...

2009-Oct-05 14:51:35 by nleroy:
nmi-sles8-amd64: 

rssize as returned by getProcInfo 4908 is much larger than was allocated 3072

This value is correct, as reported by ps.

2009-Oct-05 14:53:00 by nleroy:
nmi-0025 (ia64_sles_8) 

rssize as returned by getProcInfo 6768 is much larger than was allocated 3072

This is correct, as reported by ps.

2010-Nov-19 07:15:09 by matt:
What version did these changes go into?
